header.title: wxSysColourChangedEvent

description.p: This class is used for system colour change events, which are generated when the user changes the colour settings using the control panel. This is only appropriate under Windows.

Remark: The default event handler for this event propagates the event to child windows, since Windows only sends the events to top-level windows. If intercepting this event for a top-level window, remember to call the base class handler, or to pass the event on to the window's children explicitly.
This class is derived (and can use functions) from: wxEvent

section.title: Events
section.p: Use wxEvtHandler:connect/3 with wxSysColourChangedEventType to subscribe to events of this type.
